p: A secoadianane-type steroid ( 135) was found and identified in the herbaceous plant Dorstenia brasiliensis (Moraceae) [ 219, 220]. A polycyclic peroxide called vielanin D ( 136), which showed anti-plasmodial activity, was extracted from fresh and dry leaves of the plant Senecio selloi [ 221]. The peroxy steroid (16 S,23 R)-16,23-epoxy-23,25-epidioxycycloartan-3-one ( 137) was found in the Texas yellow-star, Lindheimera texana (Asteraceae) [ 222].
